I dont think the intro is the correct place for this criticism.
Caveat that Blu-ray disk players won't play BD-R or BD-RE disks authored on a home computer.
/* Origins */ It is misleading to allow consumer to think that they can author a disk on their home computer and play it on a commercial Blu-Ray player.
/* Blu-ray Disc recordable */ Most commercial set top boxes cannot play Blu-ray disks recorded on a computer.

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 174186922 --- Read the *other* article. It clearly states "both the HD DVD and Blu-ray camps met one last time to make peace". Stop the "it's all sony's fault" biasing.
redo previous edit. Caddy article is contemporaneous with, and explains, DVD Forum vote. Attempt to tone down conspiracy-theory flavor of section.
/* Blu-ray Disc / HD DVD comparison */ region-coding disadvantage of blu-ray
Reverting BDA -> Sony again. Please read the article; it specifically calls out Sony. If you want to mention other companies, please find a better reference.
/* Blu-ray Disc / HD DVD comparison */ 51 gig HD-DVD players do not exist.
I did a quick review. The article states: "both the HD DVD and Blu-ray camps met one last time to try and make peace", not specifically Sony nor Toshiba
/* External links */ removed link spam (some are already listed under references)
clarify that DRM is not magic
/* History */ rv some of the "Sony|Toshiba" --> "BDA|DVD Forum" changes because articles specifically mention Sony and Toshiba. They are NOT the same thing

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 172873195 ---- By the time the DVD Forum was looking for a new DVD upgrade, the Blu-ray Disc had eliminated the caddy (instead using TDK's tough coating).
/* History */ add (sourced) bit about caddy to history. link to image
/* List of Blu-ray devices */ That's not a reference.
/* History */ Replace "Sony" with Blu-ray Disc Association & "Toshiba" with "DVD Forum" where appropriate (these negotiations take place between Many companies, not just one company).
/* History */ Oh. And also HD Betacam.
/* History */ No cheap method? Okay. Many of us have been recording HD using Digital VHS since the 90s.
